Toggle Menu

salt.modules.mongodb

Module to provide MongoDB functionality to Salt

configuration

This module uses PyMongo, and accepts configuration details as parameters as well as configuration settings: 

mongodb.host: 'localhost'
mongodb.port: 27017
mongodb.user: ''
mongodb.password: ''

This data can also be passed into pillar. Options passed into opts will overwrite options passed into pillar.

db_exists

Syntax

salt.modules.mongodb.db_exists(
								name,
								user=None,
								password=None,
								host=None,
								port=None
								)

Details

Checks if a database exists in Mongodb

CLI Example:

salt '*' mongodb.db_exists <name> <user> <password> <host> <port>

db_list

Syntax

salt.modules.mongodb.db_list(
								user=None,
								password=None,
								host=None,
								port=None
								)

Details

List all Mongodb databases

CLI Example:

salt '*' mongodb.db_list <user> <password> <host> <port>

db_remove

Syntax

salt.modules.mongodb.db_remove(
								name,
								user=None,
								password=None,
								host=None,
								port=None
								)

Details

Remove a Mongodb database

CLI Example:

salt '*' mongodb.db_remove <name> <user> <password> <host> <port>

find

Syntax

salt.modules.mongodb.find(
								collection,
								query=None,
								user=None,
								password=None,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								database='admin'
								)

insert

Syntax

salt.modules.mongodb.insert(
								objects,
								collection,
								user=None,
								password=None,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								database='admin'
								)

Details

Insert an object or list of objects into a collection

CLI Example:

salt '*' mongodb.insert '[{"foo": "FOO", "bar": "BAR"}, {"foo": "BAZ", "bar": "BAM"}]' mycollection <user> <password> <host> <port> <database>

remove

Syntax

salt.modules.mongodb.remove(
								collection,
								query=None,
								user=None,
								password=None,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								database='admin',
								w=1
								)

Details

Remove an object or list of objects into a collection

CLI Example:

salt '*' mongodb.remove mycollection '[{"foo": "FOO", "bar": "BAR"}, {"foo": "BAZ", "bar": "BAM"}]' <user> <password> <host> <port> <database>

user_create

Syntax

salt.modules.mongodb.user_create(
								name,
								passwd,
								user=None,
								password=None,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								database='admin'
								)

Details

Create a Mongodb user

CLI Example:

salt '*' mongodb.user_create <name> <user> <password> <host> <port> <database>

user_exists

Syntax

salt.modules.mongodb.user_exists(
								name,
								user=None,
								password=None,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								database='admin'
								)

Details

Checks if a user exists in Mongodb

CLI Example:

salt '*' mongodb.user_exists <name> <user> <password> <host> <port> <database>

user_list

Syntax

salt.modules.mongodb.user_list(
								user=None,
								password=None,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								database='admin'
								)

Details

List users of a Mongodb database

CLI Example:

salt '*' mongodb.user_list <user> <password> <host> <port> <database>

user_remove

Syntax

salt.modules.mongodb.user_remove(
								name,
								user=None,
								password=None,
								host=None,
								port=None,
								database='admin'
								)

Details

Remove a Mongodb user

CLI Example:

salt '*' mongodb.user_remove <name> <user> <password> <host> <port> <database>
